Class AbstractGraph
    java.lang.Object
      AbstractGraph
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractGraphExtended

    public abstract class AbstractGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    Abstract base class for graphs. A graph is a set of vertices and a set of edges. Vertices are represented by integers from 0 to n - 1. Edges are ordered pairs of vertices.

      Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractGraph(int numV, boolean directed) Construct a graph with the specified number of vertices and the directed flag.

      Constructor Detail

        AbstractGraph

        public AbstractGraph(int numV,
             boolean directed)
        Construct a graph with the specified number of vertices and the directed flag. If the directed flag is true, this is a directed graph.
        Parameters:
        numV - The number of vertices
        directed - The directed flag

        loadEdgesFromFile

        public void loadEdgesFromFile(java.util.Scanner scan)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Load the edges of a graph from the data in an input file. The file should contain a series of lines, each line with two or three data values. The first is the source, the second is the destination, and the optional third is the weight.
        Parameters:
        scan - The buffered reader containing the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

        createGraph

        public static Graph createGraph(java.util.Scanner scan,
                boolean isDirected,
                java.lang.String type)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Factory method to create a graph and load the data from an input file. The first line of the input file should contain the number of vertices. The remaining lines should contain the edge data as described under loadEdgesFromFile.
        Parameters:
        scan - The Scanner connected to the data file
        isDirected - true if this is a directed graph, false otherwise
        type - The string "Matrix" if an adjacency matrix is to be created, and the string "List" if an adjacency list is to be created
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is neither "Matrix" nor "List"
        java.io.IOException
